remarks.para: May be inoperative provided equipment cooling airflow is verified to be operative before each flight.

placard.para: Placard near EICAS "EQUIPMENT COOLING AIRFLOW DETECTION SYSTEM INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

maintenance.para: When the equipment cooling airflow detection system is inoperative, indicated by EICAS status messages "EQPT CLG FLOW", "EQPT CLG SENSOR" or "EQPT CLG TEST" being displayed, use the following procedures to verify equipment cooling airflow is normal. If normal equipment cooling cannot be established, then the aircraft cannot be dispatched.

numlitem.para: Remove and stow the connector from the respective equipment cooling sensor associated with the displayed EICAS message and perform the following procedures based on the associated EICAS maintenance message.

FWD EQ SUP FLOW (M) (Sensor TS5292) – Remove the right HSI per maintenance manual instructions and verify that airflow can be felt with a hand located against the first officers control column. Reinstall the HSI per maintenance manual instructions.
FWD EQ EXH FLOW (M) (Sensor TS5293) – Verify that air is exhausted at the equipment cooling overboard exhaust valve.

AFT EQ FLOW (M) – Remove a unit, per maintenance manual instruction, from the E6 rack and verify that airflow can be felt with a hand placed against the bottom of the next higher shelf. Reinstall the unit per maintenance manual instructions.
Perform the following procedures based on the associated EICAS Maintenance message.
FWD EQ SUP SNSR (M) – Perform check procedure identified in 1.a.
FWD EQ EXH SNSR (M) – Perform check procedure identified in 1.b.
AFT EQ SUP SNSR (M) – Perform check procedure identified in 1.c.
Perform check procedures identified in 1.a., 1.b., and 1.c. If only EQPT CLG TEST is displayed, sensor connectors do not need to be disconnected.
